page.title: 04Farming
page.content: The first week of May is the most important month of the whole year in this district.Artificial and natural manures are spread on the grass and the cattle which have been kept inside for six months are put out to feed.The farmer sows barley which is used for winter feed.Cutting of grass for silage starts in June. Some of the fields of grass are kept for hay and others for summer feed of cattle. Practically every farm is given over to beef cattle production.In August the barley is cut and dressed with a chemical called 'propcorn' to prevent it going mouldy.At the beginning of November the cattle are brought in and fed every day and the byre cleaned. From the middle of February until May, calving keeps the farmer busy.
